title: 820-00840-a
message:
This board came from another service, they repaired it and changed the U7100 but it turns off after power on.

I changed U7100 to discard but now it stays at 20V and 267 ma.

PPVCCCPU_S0G is 0V.

I have ALL_SYS_PWRGD 3.2v

CPUVR_PWM2 2.49V
CPUVR_PWM1 2.49V

I am missing PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK

title: 820-00840-a
message:
Do you get L7370 voltage?
Tried known good BIOS?

Work with the board alone on the desk.

title: 820-00840-a
message:
L7370 : 1V

I haven't tried bios yet.

The equipment arrived on, only it turned off and showed Chinese letters

title: 820-00840-a
message: If board stopped to turn on after you've changed U7100, recheck your job; possibly knocked off components, bad solders.

title: 820-00840-a
message:
ok, I saw that it had a consumption of 200ma fixed. Then I put the thermal camera and it heats me R7733.

I remove U7700 and now the machine changes to 19V and consumption of 6ma.

I already have the voltage of PM_PCH_SYS_PWORK 2.95V

PPVCCOPC_S0G beeps me to ground, but on ohm scale it's 060.1

title: 820-00840-a
message:
Low resistance to ground on CPU coils is normal.

Did you apply power without U7700???
The board may be trash now...

title: 820-00840-a
message: that's right, remove U7700 and the motherboard takes 19v and consumes as if it turned on

title: 820-00840-a
message:
Big error; don't do that ever again!

Change Q7730 and U7700.
Be sure all traces and surrounding components are good; pay atention to R7731/33 and R/C7730.

Then pray half hour and test the board again with power...

title: 820-00840-a
message:
the problem was Q7730.

Now the board when connecting the battery flex does not finish turning on, it restarts the system.

When disconnecting the flex it turns on without problem.

title: 820-00840-a
message: Try known good battery; not "new chinese".

title: 820-00840-a
message: I already placed the motherboard in another case with a good battery.

title: 820-00840-a
message:
Is the battery charging in off state?
If starts in SMC bypass, still turns off?

title: 820-00840-a
message:
Does it make any difference that the machine when turned on without the battery flex, does not show an X in the battery icon when showing the login?

I have put another plate and I have done the same to remove the flex from the battery and it shows an X where the battery icon is.

title: 820-00840-a
message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 88624, member: 682"]
Big error; don't do that ever again!

Change Q7730 and U7700.
Be sure all traces and surrounding components are good; pay atention to R7731/33 and R/C7730.

Then pray half hour and test the board again with power...
[/QUOTE]

Before finding the fault here, I had changed the Bios for another of the same model only from a different manufacturer.

Could this have affected something?

Should I reprogram new Bios with your serial number?

title: 820-00840-a
message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 88655, member: 682"]
Is the battery charging in off state?

no it is not loading

If starts in SMC bypass, still turns off?
[/QUOTE]

title: 820-00840-a
message:
Put back original BIOS; or use known good dump.

Check voltage and diode mode to ground on SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

title: 820-00840-a
message:
put the bios originally.

Voltages on i2c is 3.38v

Diode mode is 444 on both

title: 820-00840-a
message:
Other MLB recognizes and charges this battery?
Inspect both ends of battery data cable.

title: 820-00840-a
message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 88678, member: 682"]
Other MLB recognizes and charges this battery?
R: I have put a board from another model but a1708 in the top case that has the bad board and everything works perfectly, it charges well.

Inspect both ends of battery data cable.
R: I already changed the flex of the battery identification.
[/QUOTE]

title: 820-00840-a
message: Then try known good SMC.
